items.title: 'Grief with no ending': Australia holds day of mourning to remember Bondi victims
items.summary: It is the first time Australia has observed a national day of mourning since the death of Queen Elizabeth II in 2022.

items.title: Kenedi carried a baby for one of many Australians who have no option at home
items.summary: Some experts believe Australian surrogacy laws are ineffective and lead many couples desperate to start a family to seek options overseas.

items.title: Multiple people, including children, missing in New Zealand holiday park landslip
items.summary: A hillside has given way at a campsite in Mount Maunganui following rare "threat to life" weather warnings.

items.title: Melbourne mayor condemns vandalism of 150-year-old colonial monuments
items.summary: Pioneer Monument and Separation Memorial in Melbourne's Flagstaff Gardens have been vandalised ahead of Australia Day.

items.title: 'Doomsday scenario': Death toll in Pakistan mall fire climbs to around 50 people
items.summary: The inferno is Karachi's largest fire in more than a decade.

items.title: Trump says US has reached a deal with NATO on Greenland framework
items.summary: NATO says talks between Denmark, Greenland and the US will aim to ensure that Russia and China never gain a foothold in Greenland.

items.title: Family 'shattered' by Canadian backpacker's death on holiday in Australia
items.summary: The devastated family of 19-year-old Piper James is waiting for news on the cause of her death.

items.title: What is the Chagos Islands deal, and why has Trump accused the UK of 'stupidity'?
items.summary: The UK agreed to hand the Chagos Islands to Mauritius in a deal that the Trump administration previously backed.

items.title: 'This should be good news': The koala success story with a catch
items.summary: Koala numbers in some areas are "concerning" researchers, who predict populations could become unsustainable.

items.title: 'A pioneer and an inspiration': Marie Bashir, NSW's first female governor, dies aged 95
items.summary: Dame Marie Bashir is being remembered for a lifetime of service after her death at the age of 95.

items.title: 'Racist' social media posts of NT Administrator spark calls for Commonwealth to intervene
items.summary: The chairman of one of the Northern Territory's most powerful land councils has called for David Connolly's appointment to be reviewed in the wake of the revelations.

items.title: $1.5 billion for a seat: Is Trump's new Board of Peace an 'irreparable' threat?
items.summary: Experts say Trump's new body is susceptible to nepotism and corruption, and could undermine the role of the United Nations.

items.title: Macron warns of 'world without rules' after Trump shares texts from European leaders
items.summary: Emmanuel Macron said France preferred "respect to bullies" and rejected "unacceptable" tariffs.

items.title: Labor's hate speech laws pass parliament in late-night vote
items.summary: The federal government has struck a last-minute deal with the Liberals to pass contentious new laws targeting hate groups.

items.title: NSW protest restrictions extended with limits allowing 'Invasion Day' rallies to proceed
items.summary: Protesters will be able to rally as planned on 26 January after the NSW Police commissioner made exemptions to ongoing protest restrictions.

items.title: New gun laws pass parliament as prime minister says reforms not 'targeting farmers'
items.summary: Australia has tightened its gun laws after returning for two emergency days of parliament to respond to the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: 'Should take it seriously': Warning for Australia as Trump faces EU trade backlash
items.summary: Experts have told SBS News that Trump's latest tariffs could lead to a global trade war and economic upheaval.

items.title: Bob Katter recognises Middle Eastern heritage, months after threatening reporter about it
items.summary: Months after raising his fist at a journalist, Bob Katter has acknowledged that his grandfather migrated from the Middle East.

items.title: Four shark attacks in 48 hours: Governments pressured to act, as swimmers told to visit pools
items.summary: Four separate shark bites in three days have forced a string of beaches to be closed.

items.title: Is NATO dead in the water? Experts say the once-strong alliance is now 'limping on'
items.summary: US-Europe relations have been deteriorating, threatening NATO and leaving Australia in an awkward position.

items.title: Jewish teens left shaken by alleged antisemitic attack, police say
items.summary: A group of Orthodox Jewish teenagers were pursued by a driver allegedly yelling antisemitic abuse, Victoria Police said on Tuesday.

items.title: NSW shark attacks: How can you swim safely and avoid a shark bite?
items.summary: Experts say murky waters are prime conditions for shark attacks.

items.title: Trump links Greenland push to Nobel snub, says he will '100 per cent' follow through on tariff threats
items.summary: EU leaders are holding an emergency summit on Thursday to discuss their response to one of the gravest crises in years to hit transatlantic ties.

items.title: Coalition divided over hate laws despite Liberal 'fixes', as Greens flag free speech concerns
items.summary: Labor's anti-hate laws are expected to pass after securing crucial Liberal support, which Sussan Ley says has "fixed" the bill.
